config_description: Compression to apply to the commit log. If omitted, the commit log will be written uncompressed.  LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate compressors are supported.
developer_understanding_on_working: The 'commitlog_compression' configuration is used to specify the compression algorithm to apply to the commit log. The code initializes a Configuration object with the compression setting obtained from DatabaseDescriptor.getCommitLogCompression(). The supported compressors are LZ4, Snappy, and Deflate.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The triggering frequency of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration depends on when the CommitLog class is instantiated. Typically, this configuration is set during the initialization of the CommitLog object.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the 'commitlog_compression' configuration option on the system is related to the size of the commit log files. Using compression can reduce the disk space usage for commit log storage but may introduce additional CPU overhead for compression and decompression operations.
